alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 4:44AM EDT until May 02 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 4.6 feet Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.2 feet on 08/23/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.7 Tue 4 am 5.1 4.8 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 500 PM EDT.
